reviews.text: I stayed her due to a work conference and can honestly say it was one of the worst hotels I've ever stayed in. Unfortunately I didn't check the reviews first.
reviews.title: Stay Far Away!

reviews.text: I agree with some other reviews - circa 1970s furniture and terrible musty smell in the hallyways and my room. There was so much dust in my room - on lamps, in the bathroom around the mirror and even on the coffee pot! I'm sorry but there is NO excuse for dust - what is housecleaning doing?? One of my towels was also dirty. The wall area around the door safety chain was worn and tattered. In addition, it certainly was not quiet - maybe it is on the other side. My room was over the "overflowing dumpster" mentioned by someone else and near the exit off Route 91 so I got to hear all the trucks as they slowed and rattled toward the exit all night. It was truly awful. Also I could barely get to sleep thinking of what might be lurking in the room. Others at our conference complained of ants in their bathrooms. And it wasn't that cheap - we got a conference rate of $89 and after a certain date it was $119. A collegue stayed at the Holiday Inn in town and it was fine. They must get college students or families of college students to avoid renovating and stay in business. Stay away!
reviews.title: Won't ever stay there again!!

likes.liked: — wireless internet & matresses were pretty comfortable
likes.disliked: — no A/C, power outlets didn't work, power going out in room, vending machines on our floor were out-of-order, no breakfast roomservice, dark parking lot, etc, etc,

reviews.text: When we booked the hotel I didn't think it would really even matter where we stayed as long as it was clean, because we would only be in the room to sleep and get ready in the morning, so we didn't need anything extravagant. Wow, was I wrong!!
reviews.title: Beware of this hotel!
atrium pool, great treat for kids
reviews.text: When we first got there, we just noticed small things... like if your room is in the back and they tell you you have to go in parking area C, there are not many parking spaces close to the stairs. You have to park a little ways from the door you enter, not to mention there was very little outside lighting back there, so it was a little scary to be loaded down with bags walking out there, and I didn't love leaving my car in such a dark lot with only trees behind us.

reviews.title: Excellent Value
reviews.text: Then, we got to the room where we quickly found out that hot & cold are backwards on the bathroom sink as we scald our hands a couple times. Next, our air-conditioner quit working in the middle of the night. Our room didn't have any outside doors or windows to open to get some cool air, because it was cold outside. It only opened to the indoor pool area so it filled up with steamy, hot, chlorine smelling air, so you felt like you were trying to get ready in a sauna. It was not very pleasant!! Of course they didn't have any other rooms to move us to.

reviews.title: Not worth what they charge
reviews.text: I paid $74/night and spent 2 nights there. Good thing it was a busy weekend and I didn't spend a lot of time in the room. The whole place smells like mildew, is very dark and from outside looks abandoned. They charge around $150/night as regular rate and it is absolutely not worth that. I don't even think that it's worth the $74/night I paid. They do not have the hotel tv channel that you can use for check out so when I left at 6:15 am, I went to the lobby .No one was there and there were no instructions anywhere on how to check out so I just left my key in the key box. I wouldn't spend another night there. I'd go to the Best Western downt the street which is closer to downtown Northampton anyway.

reviews.title: needs some work
reviews.text: In town for an wedding, we stayed 2 nights at this hotel. In our first room we discovered the toilet han obviously not been cleaned. The hotel staff quickly reassigned us to a clean, but smaller room. When I attempted to use the iron in the room I discovered it had plastic melted onto the ironing surface. Fortunately I spotted the mess before using the iron. Again the staff was apologetic and replaced the iron. A little quality control over room condition is needed. Overall the place needs a face lift. The rooms and public areas are dark and outdated. Our mattress was lumpy and the entire facility smelled stale.The indoor pool was nice, but the sides of it had the typical scum build up that indicates a lack of routine cleaning. Breakfast was more than adequate and the only highlight of our stay.

reviews.title: Nice place...
reviews.text: At $149 a night this place is overpriced. I would not stay here again.

reviews.title: Kind of Gross
reviews.text: We were in Northampton for a couple days and were assigned to this hotel by Hotwire. It is right off the highway a couple minutes from "downtown" Northampton. The hotel has an interesting layout with winding halls and an indoor pool (with lots of sunlight) in the middle.

reviews.title: Great experience
reviews.text: I can't believe we stayed in the same place as the other reviewers!! Room was clean and comfortable; couldn't have been nicer. Didn't use the pool, but it looked beautiful. After nine years of college related trips, we spent a weekend here and it was the best experience we've had. (We've stayed in the NoHo area Best Westerns, HoJo, Hampton and Super 8.)

reviews.title: Ok as a last resort
reviews.text: This time we took the dog, and called in advance to make sure we didn't have to bring any special documentation and the desk said they would make sure the ionizer was turned on, since it was also the smoker's room and we're not smokers. Room was clean and fresh; bed was very comfortable. Parking in the back of Area C was fine. Enough spaces, well-lit for the country.

reviews.title: A bit tired and needs a serious upgrade! Not worth the price! SCARY!
reviews.text: Had dinner and breakfast in Montana's restaurant. Quirky Old West decor; food was very good. And on a rainy Friday night with a haunted hayride out of the question, we attended the Skeleton Crew Theatre interactive show in the pavillion in the rear of the hotel, which was an unexpected treat.

reviews.title: Surprisingly Pleasant
reviews.text: Had to travel to Amherst on a last-minute family emergency and this was the only hotel within reasonable distance that my cousin was able to find with a room available, literally, as the place was packed.

reviews.title: Good hotel for the price
reviews.text: As most other posters have mentioned, the hotel needs serious, serious updating. I stayed in the lower C level which felt a little like a mock dungeon at a cheesy tourist attraction. The room doors are metal green and the decor is dark and tired. The lobby is equally dark although both the steak house and bar were doing brisk business the night I arrived.

reviews.title: A hell of a lot of character. Oak and gas fireplaces everywhere.
reviews.text: Don't judge this book by it's cover. The outside is not very nice, However, once I went in...wow! This hotel is a flashback to the 1970s. Oak everywhere, gas fireplaces and sitting areas everywhere...lots of nooks and crannys. It does have some issues, but overall it was a very interesting place with a lot of character and interesting layout. The center of the hotel is a dome that is over an indoor pool, with hallways like arms that spread out from the pool. Each hall opens into a large family room type setting with gas fireplaces sitting areas and soft couches..Oak everywhere from floor to ceiling. This was a super high class hotel in the 1970s (think it used to be a Hilton) and it is nice to see that places like this still exist. It could use a little work.(leaking problems form the dome over the pool in heavy rain), but over all it was very interesting highclass retro place. Nice steakhouse and bar right on the premises. If you are looking for a place with character and are not high maintanence then this is the place for you. The rooms are clean and modern. They were renovated in 2006. I would still rate this as a 2.5 star hotel, just because of the small structural issues it has. It would have been a 4 star back in the day. Stay here, and support these old classics.

reviews.title: Creaky Convenience
reviews.text: Rooms and furniture were old and could have used better maintenance. Winter heating is a bit noisy and uneven. Hallways were dank and musty-smelling.

reviews.title: Pleasantly Surprised!
reviews.text: Convenience was excellent. Other affordable lodging available in Hadley, but you'll get stuck in the Coolidge Bridge traffic going back to Northampton.

reviews.title: Good hotel
